definition: (literary) to hold (in the hand)/to challenge/to provoke
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: The week have their own places in the world as well as the strong.
sentences.chinese: 像强者一样，搦者在世界上也有自己的位置。

sentences.english: Enforcement of such scholars take hold a brush, stippling sway, they dress.
sentences.chinese: 文人执之如搦毛笔，点画挥洒，气定神闲。

sentences.english: The next day, Zhang Ren led several thousand out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 次日，张任引数千人马，摇旗呐喊，出城搦战。

definition: ancient weapon with a tip shaped like a hand or claw
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
to bleed from the nose (or from the ears, gums etc)/fig. to be defeated
callus (patch or hardened skin)/corns (on the feet)
to ward off (a blow)/to withstand/to defend
